revised_title: Chemical Repulsion: A New Phenomenon in Chemical Reactions
topics: Diffusion and Flow in Chemical Reactions
tldr: Dr. Edmund J. Mills discovers a new phenomenon called 'chemical repulsion,' where chemical reactions can occur at a distance and exclude one another. He demonstrates this through experiments using baric chloride and hydric sulfate, showing that chemical action can take place at a distance and that multiple identical chemical actions can completely exclude one another.
